intro: Pseudomussaenda angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pseudomussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
